member.summary: Checks if a recursion should be stopped.

The value of the parent object

The PropertyInfo instance of the child object belonging to the given parent object

member.summary: Event raised, when property is changed.

member.name: P:SIT.Components.ObjectComparer.Configuration.ClassDescriptions
member.summary: Gets or sets a list of class descriptions, describing the types to be regarded by object comparer

member.name: T:SIT.Components.ObjectComparer.MetadataRetrievalOptions
member.summary: Options defining types of how metadata about objects are retrieved.

member.name: F:SIT.Components.ObjectComparer.MetadataRetrievalOptions.ReflectCompareAttributes
member.summary: Get types and properties to read by reflection through defined CompareAttributes (Default)
member.remarks: This is the default option and lets you decorate your classes with the CompareAttribute attribute. ObjectComparer iterates all properties of the objects which have to be compared and searches for the CompareAttribute.

member.name: F:SIT.Components.ObjectComparer.MetadataRetrievalOptions.ReflectDescriptions
member.summary: Get types and properties to read by reflection through pre-configured lists of properties
member.remarks: This option is used in a scenario where you describe the types and their properties which have to be reflected in an external data store. If you use this option then ObjectComparer does not search for the CompareAttribute attributes. The advantage is that not all properties of an object which has to be compared are iterated.

member.name: F:SIT.Components.ObjectComparer.MetadataRetrievalOptions.EmitPropertyDescription
member.summary: Reserved for future use.
member.remarks: Feature has to be designed and implemented.

member.summary: Takes two snap shots of one object and compares the both values of the property which is defined as IdProperty
member.param: Snap shot of an object a representing state s0
Snap shot of an object a representing state s1

member.name: T:SIT.Components.ObjectComparer.Tools
member.summary: Some helping tools

member.name: M:SIT.Components.ObjectComparer.Tools.GetAttribute(System.Object,System.Type)
member.summary: Searches for a attribute of a type on a given object
member.param: The object which to search on
The type of the attribute to search
member.returns: If the attribute is found it is returned, otherwise null
member.remarks: The search for the attribute also includes checks for the BaseType of the attribute. That means, if you create a new attribute class "A2Attribute" which derives from A1Attribute and you use A2Attribute on a class C then the search for A1Attribute on class C returns an instance of A1Attribute.
